intro: Mimulus pubescens, commonly known as the fuzzy monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, orange-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and in open woodlands. It belongs to the family Physaleaceae and is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats. Mimulus pubescens is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
